groups.name: Codemod
groups.comments: These are automated code modifications to update codebase to new standards or libraries. More are available at app.codemods.dev. These can be run as npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref or npx codemod react/19/replace-string-ref --target (to target a specific file/path).

groups.name: Monthly Maintenance
groups.comments: Maintenance steps to be performed on a monthly basis to ensure codebase health.

sections.name: React 19 - Migration
sections.description: Tests and updates related to migrating to React 19.

code.content: Test responsive design works correctly for all media types (screen, print, speech).
Test print styles render correctly - verify page breaks, margins, and print-specific CSS.
Test screen display renders correctly across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports.
Test layout adapts correctly for portrait orientation (mobile/tablet). Verify no horizontal overflow.
Test layout utilizes landscape orientation effectively (wide screens). Verify readable line lengths.
Test light color scheme has sufficient contrast ratios (WCAG AA) and no visual artifacts.
Test dark color scheme has sufficient contrast ratios, no pure blacks/whites causing eye strain, and respects user preference.

items.name: Check for styles that are overwritten (browser inspect)

code.content: Validate Entries

items.name: Remove type from stylesheet ref (no longer required)

code.content: Empty alt
Valid alt
Valid title

items.name: Chrome DevTools: Validate state - Check for unused state
Chrome DevTools: Check network tab for missing files (images), connection issues, etc.
Inspect style: Click through elements to check for unused or invalid styles.
Set 'object-shorthand' to 'always' or 'warn' in 'rules' section. Property shorthand allows you to omit the property name when it matches the variable name, making the code cleaner.
TSConfig.json - Check for new and deprecated options Typescript

code.content: npm doctor
npm dedupe
npm audit

items.name: npm audit - Check for package vulnerabilities

code.content: npm outdated

items.name: npm outdated - Check for package updates

code.content: npm prune
Measure Cumulative Layout Shift using Chrome DevTools or PageSpeed Insights. Target: 0.1 or lower.

items.name: Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) - visual stability of a page as it loads

code.content: Measure Interaction to Next Paint using Chrome DevTools. Target: 200ms or less. Replace FID measurements.

items.name: Interaction to Next Paint (INP) - measures user interface responsiveness.  replaces First Input Delay (FID)

code.content: Measure Largest Contentful Paint using Chrome DevTools or Lighthouse. Target: 2.5 seconds or less.

items.name: Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) - time between the browser starting to load a page and the largest content element appearing
Input - Click on Label
items.goal: Clicking the label sets focus to or activates the form control

items.name: 1. Enter value 2. Save 3. Delete value 4. Save
Typescript Improvements - Using typescript [latest version], are there any improvements that can be implemented?
Javascript Improvements - Using javascript ES2025, are there any improvements that can be be implemented?
Javascript Improvements2 - Update to use findLast(), findLastIndex(), toSorted(), and toReversed() where applicable.
Javascript ES2023 Array Method Improvements - Update to use findLast(), findLastIndex(), toSorted(), and toReversed() where applicable.
Javascript Iterable Type Updates - Update to use Iterable where applicable.
Javascript Iterable Type Updates - Update to use RegExp.escape where applicable.
Javascript RegExp.escape Implementation - Update to use RegExp.escape where applicable.
Javascript RegExp.escape Implementation - Update to use Promise.try where applicable.

items.notes: 12/25/2025 - Limited browser support.  Check compatibility before implementing (caniuse.com)
items.name: Javascript Iteratable - Implement Temporal API.
React Improvements - Are there react 19.2.3 enhancements that can be made?
HTML5 - Is the latest and appropriate HTML5 elements used?
CSS - Are there improvements to CSS that can be made?
Styles - Are there any styles defined in components that should be moved to main.css?
Immutable - Look for opportunties to improve Immutability in codebase.

SOLID - Validate use of SOLID [ Single Responsibility Principle (SRP),  Open/Closed Principle (OCP), Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP), Interface Segregation Principle (ISP), Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP) ] principles in codebase.
Class Components - Convert any class components to functional components and hooks.
Lazy Loading - Implement lazy loading components.
Re-renders - Look for any unnecessary re-renders.
Scripts: Type Check - npm run type-check
Scripts: Lint Fix - npm run lint:fix

items.notes: Find unused files, dependencies, and exports
items.name: Scripts: Knip - npm run knip
Error Handling - Review error handling patterns across the codebase and suggest improvements for user-facing error messages and error recovery
Accessibility - Analyze accessibility (a11y) issues - check for proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus management, and screen reader support
React Query Optimization - Review and optimize React Query usage - check staleTime, cacheTime, retry logic, and identify opportunities for prefetching
Custom Hooks - Identify opportunities to create custom hooks to reduce duplication and improve code reusability
API Security - Review API security - validate input sanitization, rate limiting effectiveness, and error information exposure
Bundle Size - Analyze bundle size and suggest code splitting opportunities beyond lazy loading

items.notes: Some of these feel too strict: e.g., noImplicitAny, strictNullChecks, strictFunctionTypes
items.name: TypeScript Strict Mode - Review TypeScript strict mode usage and suggest enabling stricter compiler options
Prop Drilling - Identify prop drilling issues and suggest Context API or state management improvements
Styled Components Performance - Review styled-components usage and identify performance issues or patterns to improve
Testing - Suggest implementing React Testing Library tests for critical user flows
Form Validation - Review form validation patterns and suggest consistency improvements using Zod or similar
SSR/SSG - Identify opportunities for Server-Side Rendering or Static Site Generation
Image Optimization - Review and optimize image loading strategies (lazy loading, responsive images, WebP)
API Caching - Analyze API response caching strategies and suggest improvements
Memory Leaks - Check for memory leaks - useEffect cleanup, event listeners, subscriptions
Build - execute npm run build and fix all errors

items.code: Add 3 strict flags to client tsconfig: noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns, exactOptionalPropertyTypes
items.name: TypeScript Enhancement

items.code: Verify sanitizeFilePath is applied to all file upload/manipulation endpoints
items.name: Security Audit

items.code: Implement CSRF token generation and validation for mutation endpoints - future implementation
items.name: CSRF Protection

items.code: Implement authentication and authorization middleware (JWT, sessions, or OAuth) - future implementation
items.name: Authentication Middleware

items.code: Configure Web Application Firewall rules for production deployment - future implementation
items.name: WAF Rules

items.notes: 12/1/2025 - 'es2025' is not supported by Vite.  Use 'esnext' instead. This is need for features like Promise.try
items.code: check tsconfig.json and update target and lib to 'esnext' (lower case)
items.name: Javascript Version - esnext

code.content: Add a display name to every component if missing.  Add the name before the component export.

Comprehensive ESLint review: 1) Suggest additional linters/plugins, 2) Check for deprecated or missing rules, 3) Identify conflicting or duplicate rules across config files, 4) Validate rule severity levels are appropriate.
Replace ESLint and Prettier with Biome
Are there any deprecated Typescript or Javascript functions being used?

items.code: Review eslint.config files.  Are there any conflicting or duplicate rules?

items.code: Review the code for anti-patterns (God objects, tight coupling, callback hell, excessive prop drilling, magic numbers, hard-coded values, nested ternaries, massive functions >50 lines) and suggest specific refactoring improvements.

items.code: useEffectEvent is stable.  Look for opportunities in the code to use this function.

items.name: Sequential ids

items.code: Replace all named colors in components with CSS variables defined in main.css for easier theming and maintenance.
items.name: Central Color Variables

items.code: Remove unused or redundant CSS rules from the codebase to improve maintainability and performance.
items.name: Useless CSS Removal

items.code: Review all the Server API end points for consistency in naming conventions, request/response formats, and error handling.
items.name: API End points

items.code: Review all the Server API end points to validate that PUT, POST, PATCH, and DELETE requests do not have parameters: all data should be in the request body.  Fix any related routers and services.

items.code: Review all the Client API requests to validate that PUT, POST, PATCH, and DELETE requests do not have parameters: all data should be in the request body.

items.code: run replace-reactdom-render
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-use-form-state
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-use-form-state
items.comments: This codemod will replace the usages of useFormState() to use useActionState(), introduced in React v19.

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/use-context-hook
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - use-context-hook
items.comments: This codemod will convert the usage of useContext to the new hook format, introduced in React v19.

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/migration-recipe
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - migration-recipe
items.comments: This codemod run the following: replace-reactdom-render replace-string-ref replace-act-import replace-use-form-state prop-types-typescript

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-reactdom-render
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-reactdom-render
items.comments: Replaces usages of ReactDom.render() with createRoot(node).render().

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-string-ref
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-string-ref
items.comments: Replaces deprecated string refs with callback refs.

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-act-import
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-act-import
items.comments: Updates act import path from react-dom/test-utils to react.

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-use-form-state
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-use-form-state
items.comments: Replaces usages of useFormState() to use useActionState().

items.code: npx codemod@latest react/prop-types-typescript
items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - prop-types-typescript
items.comments: Codemod to convert React PropTypes to TypeScript types. WARNING: If you're not using TypeScript already, don't run this.

items.notes: 01/01/2026: Score: 94/100 - Excellent consistency across coding styles, naming conventions, and file structures. Coding Style Consistency - Naming conventions, code formatting, patterns; File Structure Consistency - Directory organization, file naming; API Pattern Consistency - Handler patterns, error responses, validation; TypeScript Usage - Type annotations, generic usage; Import Patterns - Import organization, factory usage; Error Handling Consistency - ResponseHelper usage, error formats; Documentation Consistency - JSDoc comments, inline comments; Testing Patterns - Test structure (if tests exist)
items.code: Calculate the Overall Consistency Score for the codebase.
items.name: Overall Consistency Score

items.code: Run API Router Consistency Analysis Report for the codebase.
items.name: API Router Consistency Analysis Report

items.code: Update Legacy manual handlers and Generic handler factories to simple router factory where appropriate.
items.name: API Router Consistency

items.code: Standardize on **kebab-case** for all multi-word URL paths.
items.name: API Router Consistency - Kebab-case

items.code: Validate all mutation operations use request body for data.
items.name: API Router Consistency - Request Body

items.code: Update Pattern 1: Legacy Manual Validation and Pattern 2: Zod Schema Validation (Items) to Pattern 3: Generic Handlers (Modern)
items.name: API Router Consistency - Request Body Structure

items.code: Update Pattern 1: Collection Responses and Pattern 2: Single Item Responses to Recommended: `res.json(data)` for success with data, `res.sendStatus(204)` for success without data, `{ error: "message" }` for errors
items.name: API Router Consistency - Response Structure Analysis

items.code: Status Codes Analysis: Update to modern handlers
items.name: API Router Consistency - Status Codes Analysis

items.code: Update to Modern Error Responses: `res.status(400).json({ error: 'message' })`
items.name: API Router Consistency - Modern Error Responses

items.code: Error Response Formats: Standardize on `{ error: 'message' }` format
items.name: API Router Consistency - Error Response Formats

items.code: Update all Try-Catch Patterns to Pattern 4: Generic Handler (Modern)
items.name: API Router Consistency - Try-Catch Patterns

items.code: Error Logging to use `ResponseHelper.internalError()`
items.name: API Router Consistency - Error Logging

items.code: Pattern Summary: Update all legacy patterns to modern generic handlers
items.name: API Router Consistency - Pattern Summary

items.code: Run Code Smells Report for the codebase.
items.name: Code Smells Report

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Validated - 95/100 score, excellent architecture with custom hooks pattern
items.code: Validate there is no excessive prop drilling in the codebase.
items.name: Prop Drilling

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Validated - Zero deprecated event handlers found, all using modern onKeyDown. Modern React 19 patterns confirmed.
items.code: Validate there are no deprecated event handlers (onKeyPress, componentWillMount, componentWillReceiveProps, etc.) in the codebase. Confirm modern React 19+ patterns and hooks are used throughout.
items.name: React - Deprecated APIs and Event Handlers

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Updated - Removed deprecated onKeyPress from jsx-a11y rules
items.code: Update ESLint configuration and rules for modern event handlers.
items.name: ESLint

items.code: Analyze codebase for optimization opportunities: rendering performance (memoization, virtualization), bundle size (code splitting, lazy loading), API efficiency (caching, batching), memory usage (cleanup, leaks). For each suggestion, explain expected improvement and trade-offs.
items.name: Improvements

items.code:
Generate unit tests for the following function:
[paste function]

Include tests for:
1. Normal expected inputs
2. Edge cases
3. Invalid inputs

Use [preferred testing framework] syntax.
items.name: Generate Unit Tests

items.code: Look for component instability issues - identify components that frequently re-render unnecessarily and suggest optimizations to stabilize them.
items.name: Component Instability

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Score 98/100 - Excellent. Zero functional duplicates. TypeScript version aligned (5.9.3). Consider workspace for husky/prettier/eslint deduplication (optional).
items.code: Review the package.json files for duplicate libraries - libraries that perform the same function(s) but are different packages. Suggest consolidating to a single library where possible.
items.name: Package.json - Duplicate Libraries

items.code: Review for non-optimized imports that may break tree shaking - suggest improvements to ensure optimal bundle size.
items.name: Package Imports

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Score 88/100 - Very Good. 8 redundant boolean attributes (={false}) to remove. Zero unused variables. Fragment patterns with Meta are correct React 18+ practice. Key usage excellent (95%+).
items.code: Review codebase to ensure clean JSX - suggest improvements to remove unnecessary fragments, redundant attributes, and unused variables.
items.name: Clean JSX

items.code: Here's a piece of performance-critical React code: [paste code]. Suggest optimizations to improve rendering efficiency and explain the expected improvement for each suggestion.
items.name: Performance

items.code: Act as a meticulous code reviewer. Analyze the following React component for potential performance bottlenecks, lack of accessibility (ARIA) compliance, and any deviation from standard React best practices. Suggest specific, actionable improvements for each identified issue, explaining the rationale behind each recommendation. Here is the component code: [paste code].
items.name: Code Review

items.code: Search for React components using array index as key prop (e.g., key={index}). Report occurrences and suggest using stable unique identifiers instead to prevent rendering bugs.
items.name: Array Index as Key

items.code: Review React components returning fragments containing only <Meta> or <Helmet> tags. Verify this pattern is intentional for SEO/metadata injection and not an oversight.
items.name: Fragment Pattern with Meta

items.code: Find and remove redundant boolean JSX attributes (e.g., disabled={true} should be disabled, hidden={false} should be omitted). Report count and suggest automatic fixes.
items.name: Redundant Boolean Attributes

items.code: Scan for hardcoded secrets (API keys, passwords, tokens) in codebase and environment files. Verify .gitignore excludes sensitive files.
items.name: Secrets Detection

items.code: Run accessibility audit: Check for missing alt text, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation support, color contrast ratios (WCAG AA), and semantic HTML usage.
items.name: A11y Comprehensive Audit
items.status: Good - 10 images need alt text review

items.code: Analyze bundle size using webpack-bundle-analyzer or vite-bundle-visualizer. Identify largest dependencies and suggest lazy loading or lighter alternatives.
items.name: Bundle Analysis

items.code: Identify unused CSS using PurgeCSS or similar. Report percentage of unused styles and suggest removal strategy.
items.name: Unused CSS Detection
items.status: Passed - Low risk (styled-components eliminates unused CSS)

items.code: Audit for 'any' types throughout codebase. Suggest specific type definitions or generic constraints to eliminate them.
items.name: TypeScript 'any' Audit

items.code: Check for missing return types on functions. Add explicit return type annotations for better type safety and documentation.
items.name: Function Return Types
items.status: Passed - All functions have return type annotations

items.code: Calculate test coverage percentage for components, hooks, and utilities. Target: 80%+ coverage. Identify critical paths lacking tests.
items.name: Test Coverage Analysis
items.status: Needs Work - Only 9 test files found, ~<20% coverage

items.code: Check for unused dependencies in package.json using depcheck. Remove or document why each flagged dependency is needed. Frequency: Monthly.
items.name: Unused Dependencies
items.status: Passed - Manual review shows all dependencies in use

code.content: npm uninstall eslint-plugin-react-compiler

items.name: Remove eslint-plugin-react-compiler
items.comments: This functionality has been merged into eslint-plugin-react as of v7.30.0. Remove eslint-plugin-react-compiler from package.json and update eslint-plugin-react to latest version if needed.

items.code: Verify package.json engines field specifies minimum Node.js and npm versions. Document in README.
items.name: Node Version Requirements
items.status: Passed - Engines field present: node >=20.0.0, npm >=10

items.code: Audit API endpoints documentation. Verify each endpoint has request/response examples, error codes, and authentication requirements documented.
items.name: API Documentation Audit
items.status: Needs Work - No Swagger/OpenAPI specification found

items.code: Review .gitignore completeness. Ensure all build artifacts, environment files, OS files, IDE configs, and dependency directories are excluded.
items.name: Gitignore Audit

items.code: Verify React Error Boundaries are implemented for main app sections. Ensure graceful error handling with user-friendly messages.
items.name: Error Boundary Coverage
items.status: Passed - Error boundaries at app and layout levels with fallbacks

items.code: Allow and implement any TC39 Stage 2+ features in the codebase, ensuring compatibility with current build tools and environments. Such as Promise.try, Array.fromAsync, Iterator helpers, Set methods, Decimal,Temporal,Array grouping, Import attributes, Decorator metadata,RegExp.escape,and Symbol predicates. Update ESlint rules to allow these features.
items.name: Baseline 2025

items.code: Review general-coding.instructions.md for completeness and accuracy. Ensure all coding standards and guidelines are up to date and clearly documented. Update as needed.  Use modern structures, coding, and best practices.
items.name: General-coding.instructions.md Review

items.code: Review typescript-react.instructions.md for completeness and accuracy. Ensure all coding standards and guidelines are up to date and clearly documented. Update as needed.  Use modern structures, coding, and best practices.
items.name: Typescript-react.instructions.md Review

items.code: npm install -g npm@11.7.0.
items.name: npm update

code.content: Validate overrides are necessary in package.json files. Suggest removing unnecessary overrides to simplify dependency management.

items.name: Package.json - Overrides
items.comments: Overrides can complicate dependency resolution. Ensure each override is justified.

items.name: Node Modules Cleanup
items.comments: Stop the app and manually delete the node_modules directory in both client and server folders. Then run npm install in each folder to reinstall dependencies afresh.

items.name: Dist Folder Cleanup
items.comments: Stop the app and manually delete the dist directory in both client and server folders. Then run the build script in each folder to regenerate the distribution files.

items.name: ESLint Health Check
items.comments: ESLint has a habit of silently stopping. Ensure it is running correctly and address any issues promptly. Go to Ouput | ESLint console.

code.content: Rebuild the project from GitHub (or whatever source repo you are using). 1. Make a backup copy. 2. Delete the current project. 3. Restore and validate.

items.name: Rebuild Project From Scratch
items.comments: Validate that you have all your code in source control, that you have documentation on how to build the project, and a new developer can pick up the project and run with it.

code.content: node -v   nvm install  nvm use 24.12.0  https://nodejs.org/en/download

items.name: Node.js - Update
items.comments: Make sure to update Node.js to the latest stable version (LTS) to benefit from performance improvements and security patches.  Note: Your team should all be on the same version.
